hook.text: Fashion photography sells clothes. But the best fashion images sell fantasies, moods, and identities.

buildup.text: Fashion photography emerged in the early 1900s, blending portraiture, set design, and commercial objectives.

discovery.text: Helmut Newton, Richard Avedon, and Tim Walker turned clothing advertisements into cultural statements.

twist.text: Fashion photography shapes beauty standards worldwide. Its influence on body image is powerful and controversial.

climax.text: At its best, fashion photography is art that happens to feature clothing. At its worst, it's ads with pretensions.

punchline.text: Fashion photography sells dreams, not dresses.

quiz.question: What elevates fashion photography beyond commercial advertising?
options: When it creates cultural statements and artistic visions beyond the clothing
